content.description: This route is on the far right end of Stoned Wheat Thin Cliff. Climb through a hard bulge to reach a rest on a slab. Then climb out another steep overhang, which seems a bit easier than the first, to reach a set of anchors.
Crux at the roof on second pitch.  Really great climbing on good rock. Big runout on easier terrain keeps people off this classic.  Cruxes are protected well.
content.protection: Some slings for horns on the runout would make it safer.  Maybe even some tricams in the pockets?
content.location: Same start as driller instinct and traverses hard right.  Not to be confused with the 10c unknown that branches off slightly left

content.description: Start in the dihedral as for Driller's Instinct, but continue up the corner to the top of the feature instead of heading right. There is a station just past the first roof, but skip it and climb right to the top with fun jamming and stemming. A little loose rock detracts from an otherwise very fun climb!
content.location: This is the obvious dihedral, near the middle of the Stoned Wheat Thin cliff.

content.description:
This is the obvious crack that starts as a right facing corner and joins Pull My Finger at it's second set of anchors. The start is kind of awkward and dirty. After that it gets much easier and you are mostly face climbing around the crack. If you choose, you can finish to the top of Pull My Finger in one long pitch.

I can't remember if you need a 60 or 70m rope to toprope the crack.
content.protection: Pro to 3.5" and 1 bolt (several more bolts if you top out). 2 bolt anchor/rap.

content.description: The crux is pulling the 3 intimidating bulges 160 feet off the ground. The route is well protected though, and offers great climbing. You can do the route in 3 separate pitches if you are worried about rope drag, but doing it one long rope stretcher isn't a problem (make sure you have 60m or longer 50m will be to short)
content.protection: 18 bolts, chains at the 3 separate anchors
content.location: While facing the Stoned Wheat Thin Cliff, the route goes up the wide crack on the far left, then moves out onto the left arete, and after about 20-30 feet moves onto the face. Pull the 3 bulges near the top. The top is very flat and big and offers a perfect stance to belay your partner to the top while enjoying the stunning views of the Sierra's. Walk off is to the left, you can go right but it exposes you to a nearly 200 foot fall if you slip.

content.description: Climb steep rock past three bolts to a break where a slightly overhanging wall goes above for two more bolts and the anchor.
content.location: On the right side of the Stoned Wheat Thin cliff are three shorter routes. This is the middle of the three, or the second route from the right. It is just left of a large crack.

content.description: Sustained and just a bit pumpy. Decent enough pockets present themselves just when you need them. I couldn't identify a specific crux. Nice, fun, straightforward, consistent route.
content.location:
Of the 3 bolted routes on the right side, this one is farthest to the left.

Lower off.

content.description:
Crux up high pebble pinching.  Good rock quality at the crux flaky before the crux holds.

Second pitch reachy moves on huge incuts 10b
content.protection: Bolts a little runout on the traverse when the route joins Womb With a View but easy terrain
content.location:
Starts right of Womb with a View straight up a seam feature up the face.  Joins Womb with a view at last bolt and cuts right to the anchor at the ledge on first pitch. Second pitch goes straight up from the anchors on the ledge. After reaching the ledge continue up the arÃªte to meet the anchors of womb with a view. Rap to first pitch anchor with one 60 meter rope 28 meter rap be careful.

You can climb the first pitch of Womb with View and skip the 12a pitch to make it a 10b two pitch route.

climbs.name: Driller Instinct
climbs.fa: Barry Oswick, Marshall Minobe, and Alan Hirahara.

content.description:
This is described in the guidebook as perhaps the best route at Clark Canyon. It is a beautiful, long pitch of steep climbing on great rock.

Climb the bolted, right-facing dihedral before heading out right on to the face after the fifth (?)  bolt. Climb the face to a small roof, passing it on the right, to a long, ever-steepening arete to the anchor.

Be careful lowering/rappelling off. A 70-meter rope will lower you to the first bolt of the route, from where you can downclimb to the ground. Those with less than a 70-meter rope, can use two ropes to get down or two lowers via a two-bolt anchor in the dihedral above the start.
content.location: Starts in the bolted, right-facing dihedral around the arete from Brain Tissue and Stoned Wheat Thin.

content.description: Climb a flared offwidth, protected by two bolts, to the face above. The climbing on the arete above is  a little sporty, particularly when climbing the twenty feet above the last bolt to the anchors.
content.location: Just right of the namesake crack, Stoned Wheat Thin. Starts by climbing a flared offwidth, protected by two bolts.
